newsitem.title: USA: Krantor sees charge in Q3, profitable Q4. [CORRECTED 20:30 GMT]
newsitem.headline: Krantor sees charge in Q3, profitable Q4. [CORRECTED 20:30 GMT]

text.p: Krantor Corp said Monday that it expects to take a "final charge" in the third quarter as it finalizes its accounting for the discontinuation of Island Frozen & Dairy.
In a release Monday, the company said that it expects sales activity to be profitable in the fourth quarter as a result of its Chinese joint venture.
Krantor said that it completed a $3 million financing for (corrects from "through") its joint venture for securing commitments to purchase goods from China.
The commitment involves the purchase of multiple containers of squid through the use of joint venture financing to cover the annual inventory requirements, the company added.
